content: in this legal case the claimant filed a lawsuit to divide the estate of the deceased axxx pxxxxxx among the coheirs the claimant acquired a share of the estate through a public auction the court took action on the lawsuit and the defendants agreed to it the parties submitted a written compromise to the court asking for the proceedings to be ended the court approved the compromise and closed the proceedings according to the civil procedure code when parties reach a compromise the court can end the proceedings without making a decision the court explains that the compromise has legal consequences and terminates the proceedings the compromise approval regulation states the terms of the compromise the court also explains that the termination of the proceedings through a compromise has substantive and procedural consequences unless otherwise provided by law if the compromise is annulled it can be withdrawn or canceled the compromise can also be declared inadmissible in an enforcement proceeding if the court satisfies the claim the compromise has legal consequences and the proceedings continue the parties have agreed to appeal the regulation the court will determine the distribution of procedural costs and in this case the parties have agreed that each will bear their own costs the claimant has requested a refund of half of the state fee which is allowed under the civil procedure code the court has determined that the claimant paid a state fee of 300 euros so they are entitled to a refund of 150 euros
